revised_title: Rydberg Series and Autoionization Resonances in Yttrium I Absorption Spectrum
tldr: The authors studied the absorption spectrum of yttrium vapor and identified series of autoionization resonances that converge on excited states of the Y+ ion. They determined the ionization potential with an accuracy of 1 cm^-1 and found that the previously accepted value was in error by about 2500 cm^-1. This research led to the identification of new levels of Yttrium and improved understanding of its spectrum.
